notes.text: Security update for the Linux Kernel
notes.title: Title of the patch

notes.text:
The SUSE Linux Enterprise 15 SP2 kernel was updated to receive various security and bugfixes.

The following security bug was fixed:

- CVE-2020-14386: Fixed a potential local privilege escalation via memory corruption (bsc#1176069).
notes.title: Description of the patch

notes.text: CSAF 2.0 data is provided by SUSE under the Creative Commons License 4.0 with Attribution (CC-BY-4.0).
notes.title: Terms of use

notes.text: A flaw was found in the Linux kernel before 5.9-rc4. Memory corruption can be exploited to gain root privileges from unprivileged processes. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to data confidentiality and integrity.
notes.title: CVE description
